3141592653589793238462643383279502884197169399375105820974944592 2718281828459045235360287471352662497757247093699959574966967627
3141592653589793238462643383279502884197169399375105820974944592*2718281828459045235360287471352662497757247093699959574966967627

So: what's the product of the following two 64-digit numbers?

3141592653589793238462643383279502884197169399375105820974944592

2718281828459045235360287471352662497757247093699959574966967627

8539734222673567065463550869546574495034888535765114961879601127067743044893204848617875072216249073013374895871952806582723184
8539734222673567065463550869546574495034888535765114961879601127067743044893204848617875072216249073013374895871952806582723184

# So, for multiplication of two numbers of different lengths,
is the best way to implement Karatsuba Multiplication is to append zeroes to both of them
until they are of the same length and have 2^k digits, (nearest power of two), for a natural number k)?
